inspiracio.atom
Interface AtomBean

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractAtomBean
public interface AtomBean

A business object that can be visible to clients of Atom API. This interface obliges beans to have translations from and to entries.

We have no interface inspiracio.portal.Bean; if we had it, then this interface would extend it.

Method Summary

          Convert the entry into a new bean.

Method Detail

getKey

String getKey()
Returns the key that we use to store the bean in the session. For example "form-12".

getId

Object getId()
Business objects used as Atom entries must have ID. The return type must be something that has an easy toString(). Best to use String or Integer or similar.

getETag

String getETag()
Gets an ETag value that represents the version of this business object. Whenever the business object is changed, the ETag must also change. The ETag is strong (see ETag spec in HTTP 1.1 spec). A strong ETag value is a String enclosed in double quotes and inside the String the quotes are escaped; but this method returns just the String. The clients of the method take care of quoting and escaping.

setETag

void setETag(String etag)
Sets ETag. Set a String that represents the version of this object. Must change every time the object changes. Any String is okay: clients takes care of escaping and quoting.

toEntry

Entry toEntry()
              throws Exception
Convert this bean into an Atom entry. If the Bean supports style, use plain style.

Returns:
Entry
Throws:
Exception

toEntry

Entry toEntry(boolean root,
              Style style)
              throws Exception
Convert this bean into an Atom entry.

Parameters:
root - Will the entry be the root element of an XML document? If so, toEntry should set any namespace attributes that are necessary to define the XML elements that come with the chosen style.
style -
Returns:
Entry
Throws:
Exception - XXX Can I refine this?

fromEntry

AtomBean fromEntry(Entry entry)
Convert the entry into a new bean.

Calling this method does not affect the instance on which it is called. It is as if this method is a constructor or a static method. I don't use constructors or static methods because they don't participate in inheritance.

Parameters:
entry -
Returns:
fresh bean instance

setClean

void setClean()
Sets the object as clean (clean = true;)
